results.title: Human Diversity
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Nature or Nurture (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human Diversity”.
Congenital dislocation of the hip in humans is caused by both genetic and environmental factors, and by the interaction between them. Illustrates the methodology involved in sorting out the different factors
results.description:

group_works.title: The Gee whiz graph (NP)
group_works.creator_credit: Peter Robinson, Antony Jay and Video Arts

results.title: The Gee whiz graph (NP)
results.creator_credit: Peter Robinson, Antony Jay and Video Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “How to Lie with Statistics”.
John Cleese narrates the first of a series of animated cartoons based on the book by Darrell Huff and Irving Geis. Concentrates on the suppression of zero, and the change of scale in graphs. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

group_siblings.title: The Average chap
group_siblings.creator_credit: Peter Robinson and Video Arts

results.title: The Average chap
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Lie with Statistics”.
The second in a series of animated cartoons based on the book by Darrell Huff and Irving Geis about statistical trickery. Concentrates on the use and misuse of averages. Intended for management training, colleges and schools. Narration by John Cleese. Animation by Tony Hart.

results.title: In dense traffic
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “How to Drive”.
Town driving demands great powers of concentration, road observation, the ability to react quickly to changing situations, and considerable driving skill. Patience and restraint play an important part in dense traffic driving, allowing safe distance around our vehicle as a ‘cushion of air’ and giving greater visibility of traffic movement ahead.

results.title: Remembering it all
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
Makes a recapitulation of all the points given in the previous eleven films, to show the responsibilities undertaken by a driver to check his car for roadworthiness, and to drive in a sensible, considerate manner by following the system of car control. Features First Constable Geoff Caine as The Driver.

results.title: Night driving
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
If your vision is normal and the lighting equipment of your car is in efficient working order, there is nothing to be scared of in night driving. The same section of road from a driver’s viewpoint is shown by day and by night, pointing out the different methods of detecting various features which will affect course and speed in night driving.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Conversion to automatic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
Demonstrates how the automatic transmission operates and discusses the routine procedures the driver should follow for the safe driving of an automatic vehicle.
